» Click to show Spoiler - click again to hide... «PETALING JAYA: Seeking to battle his obesity, a senior official with Malaysia Airports Holdings Berhad (MAHB) decided to do something about his appearance.The senior general manager of the human resources department signed up for a beauty skin treatment and body slimming package, costing about RM80,000.It would have been perfectly all right if he had paid for it with his own money.But anti-graft officers found this was not the case as the payment was made via a corporate credit card issued by MAHB.For this, the 41-year-old man was detained for alleged graft by a team of Malaysian Anti-Corruption Com­mission (MACC) officers at his house in Bandar Tun Razak, Cheras, yesterday.He is now being investigated on suspicion of abusing his position for personal gain.Sources said the corporate credit card was only issued to deserving senior officers for official use.Usage includes purchase of air tickets, accommodation, entertainment and meeting expenses as stated in the standard operating procedures of the company.“Initial investigations showed that the suspect misused the facility to undergo a treatment which is not covered under his terms and conditions of employment.“All medical claims for MAHB staff must be scrutinised by a third party appointed by the company,” said a source, adding that all approval must be in accordance with the “Schedule of Benefits” and “exclusion list” as clearly spelt out by the MAHB human resources department.It is learnt that the questionable treatments were done at a clinic and private hospital in the Klang Valley between December 2015 and August last year.Checks also showed that he was appointed the general manager in January 2015 before being promoted to the present post in December the same year.MACC director of investigations Datuk Simi Abd Ghani confirmed the arrest. Simi said several documents and credit cards were seized by the MACC to assist in the probe.The suspect will be taken to the court for a remand order today.MAHB, in a statement last night, said: “We have been made aware through various media reports on the arrest made by MACC on one of our employees.“Malaysia Airports had given full co-operation to MACC on this investigation and will continue to do so until it is concluded.”Read more at http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...ltAXMbVtWWBb.99
